intro: Karkinetron undulatum, commonly known as the wavy karkinetron, is a unique flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive undulating leaves, which are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the cooler months. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that help it access groundwater. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
